subject: AI
title: Supervised Learning
description: The most common way machines learn: from labeled examples.

hook.text: You hand a child 200 photos: 'this is a cat, this is not a cat.' After a while, they get it right on photos they've never seen.

buildup.text: Supervised learning works the same way. You give the model inputs paired with correct answers. It finds patterns that map inputs to outputs.

discovery.text: Email spam filters are supervised: someone labeled thousands of emails as spam or not-spam, and the model learned the signals.

twist.text: The bottleneck is usually labeling, not model complexity. Getting 10,000 accurate labels can cost more than the model training itself.

climax.text: Supervised learning dominates industry because business problems usually come with historical labeled data â€” past sales, support tickets, medical diagnoses.

punchline.text: Good labels in, good predictions out. Garbage labels in, confident garbage out.

quiz.question: What does supervised learning require?
options: A human supervisor watching the model
Labeled training data with correct answers
A reward function for good behavior
